ygData.subject: Re: Is it safe to sing AE songs in dungeons now?
ygData.msgSnippet: It s been a month now (since I have had any extended hours in Lower Guk) but... The last time I was in the Ghoul Lord room we had a runner start to take off
ygData.messageBody:
It's been a month now (since I have had any extended hours in Lower Guk)
but...

The last time I was in the Ghoul Lord room we had a runner start to take off
and instead of yelling "snare it!" they yelled: "let it go - maybe it will
pull stuff for us..."

But the last time I was in the King room, we were getting steady pulls. I
asked how do we get all these frogs when there are 80+ people in the zone?
I was told you are pretty damn deep in Lower Guk. Then our enchanter went
afk or LD during a pull or was it the room spawn. We started getting more
and more froggies beating on him. I paniced and feared them off. Heh, well,
its been a while since I'd seen quite so many froggies all at once (when
they came back with a bunch of friends.)

So, playing AE songs in dungeons? I guess it depends on: where you are in
which dungeon and what song. Fearing frogs in the King room is still a
"no-no!" When there are 6 to 8 dogs frenzied at the zone in Sol B, chain
one and fear the rest of them off (heh, they can get more friend - all of
them are already there.)

Sylly SongSynger
Bardette of 48 songs
<The Pantheon>
somewhere on Innoruuk...(and when I un-camp - somehow I got this feeling I
am really gonna Hate the Plane.)

----- Original Message -----
From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 <g4mntofcr@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, February 29, 2000 2:07 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Is it safe to sing AE songs in dungeons now?


> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> With overcrowding a problem on almost every server, I'm wondering if it is
> now safe to add these songs back to our playlist.
